alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Jackson; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 11:51PM EDT until June 15 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN GENEVA...HOUSTON...JACKSON...NORTHEASTERN HOLMES AND NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 1050 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Cowarts to 9 miles north of Marianna to 9 miles southeast of Chipley, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Chipley, Graceville, Marianna, Dothan, Taylor, Ashford, Slocomb, Cowarts, Chattahoochee, Bradford, Malone, Sneads, Malvern, Rehobeth, Cottondale, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Avon and Alford. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southeastern Alabama...Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida...and southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
